column1: Whipworm infection is an infection of the large intestine with a type of roundworm.
Whipworm infection is caused by the roundworm Trichuris trichiura.
It is a common infection that mainly affects children.
Mebendazole taken by mouth for 3 days is commonly prescribed when the infection causes symptoms.
Seek medical attention if you or your child develop bloody diarrhea.
In addition to whipworm, many other infections and illnesses can cause similar symptoms.
